author: Racyz66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: My daughter's eating disorder
body: I attended the service because my daughter has got eating disorder. The staff especially Ms Sue were very supportive and helpful. They provided us regular follow up appointments.

author: sambapn54
title: Put at ease at my DEXA scan
body: Just to say a thank you and say how well the DEXA scan went. Ben explained everything that would be done, what the scan entailed and why, he was exceptionally kind and also gave me leaflets explaining everything too. I was a little apprehensive but the appointment was well handled. A very nice young man who put me at ease.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: indigo75ken
title: Genuine staff with great potential
body:
I had an appointment at NDDH today to have a DEXA scan on my lower spine and left hip. The Radiologist was Excellent. He put me at ease and explained everything in detail. We went through my medication he compared it to last appointment in 2018. What I found so rewarding is that Ben without being familiar put myself at ease and was very knowledgeable about my case. As I was supplementary oxygen he made sure I was at ease with procedure. He went through all aspect of proposed scan and the effect it has by explaining the minimal amount of radiation used. After changing, he was polite in positioning me on the bed of the machine, always asking if it was ok to touch my body to position in certain ways. The scan was carried and although he could not give me my results he did show me the X-rays and made positive comments.  
I did say what a gentlemen's he is and who he put me at ease. I genuine guy with great potential..  
I needed to write this as it isn't often I feel like this after the first visit when meeting someone in the medical profession. I hope Ben gets well with his career...

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body:
The GP's are fantastic. I've been through 2 lots of cancer, the GP's I've been to see have helped me a great deal.
Today's telephone appointment was to order some medication, after a swift consoltation my prescription was sent to .my preferred chemist.

title: Great practice
body: That a good practice take me in time for my appointment the doctor were  very very helpful.The doctor look after me very well consult me with care .

author: pagerce48
title: Wonderful Hospice care
body:
My husband was admitted to Kilbryde Hopsice in January 2023 with a terminal cancer diagnosis. Every single member of staff were so kind and compassionate to not only my husband but to my family and I. My husband was so well taken care of and we could not have asked for more. Without the hospice, my husband wouldn't have had the care he needed.  
All of the nursing staff and volunteers were second to none and made it as much like home as possible. It was a very calming, controlled environment where we were able to spend quality time together. Our thanks go out to every single member of staff for providing us with the care we needed during the worst time of our lives.

title: Friendly practice polite staff
body: My first time using EConsult I found it to be very efficient,my message was passed on to the Gp and my health problem discussed and dealt with.

title: Prompt and friendly
body: I had a short wait before seeing the doctor, who was friendly and informative.  Overall the surgery was clean and the staff were helpful.

author: Paul Patient
title: Weekend of A&E and SUAE
body: All the staff and service were great even the food was nice. Stand out man for his humanity and commitment to has patients, Qamar, stood out a credit to the department.

title: Superb clinical service
body: I had a cataract removal and lens replacement operation 4 days ago. The entire process at the Potters Bar Community Hospital, from arrival, guidance to the surgical suite, presurgery checks and advice, surgical preparation, the actual surgical procedure, post-surgery monitgoring, advice and provision of drugs, to my departure for home, was calm, efficient, effective and confidence building. Clinical staff members were uniformly polite and reassuring - what a team! My eye is already working well. Congratulations to all involved.

title: Great physio team
body:
Excellent and efficient communication.
Extremely helpful and respectful.
Very clear in advice and further help.
Made me feel understood, relaxed and helped me a great deal in my recovery.
The staff member made me feel at ease about my pain and what I am going through.

I left feeling reassured and comforted knowing that I have exercises to aid my recovery and a full recovery plan ahead.

This staff member is a real asset for the team.

I am now looking forward to my physiotherapy sessions ahead.

title: Efficient practice
body: My appointment went ahead bang on time. The staff were welcoming and put me at my ease, explained everything well.  Very comfortable surroundings contributed to a positive experience.

title: Terrible service
body: I have been with boarder drive surgery since 1981 and has amazing service. But not now. Now unable to get appointments when needed, and no I'm not constantly wanting to see the doctor. Not can I order my repeat medication. They won't order it over the phone and the website is down with no idea of when it's getting sorted. So now. No repeat medication.

title: Excellent access
body: Excellent access, I submitted an e-cons on the Monday and received a telephone appointment with a GP the next day. Issue dealt with easily and GP was helpful and efficient.

title: Exceptional practice
body:
I accompanied my daughter to the eye casualty department yesterday and would like to commend all the staff we encountered during our visit. You were welcoming, professional and very thorough in your diagnostics and treatment.
Many thanks.

title: Wasted Time
body:
I attended UTC following a fall my child has resulting in him going over on his ankle. In which he could not apply fully pressure, his foot was swollen, he was complaining it hurt, couldn't put shoes on and at some points was screaming out in pain. His foot was also cracking and had popped before taking him in, following advice from 111. 

The waiting time is not the issue, and I fully understand the severity of the doctors strikes. My child would not be here if it wasn't for the NHS. 

My issue here is we were triaged and told he would be going to have an xray and to wait in the waiting area. I even questioned how they xray a hyperactive toddler. All fine. 

An hour and a half later, his name gets called again. I thought we were going to the xray so I had my partner wait in the waiting area while we went. 

To then have no mention of an xray and be triaged again and told to just give him paracetamol. 

I was made to feel as though I shouldn't have taken him, and I was just wasting time. When actually they wasted their own time wasted, but mine also. As well as other patients in the waiting area who were waiting to be triaged. 

I was advised not to feed my child before attending. So I didn't. So a very hungry toddler, an unnecessary extra 1.5 hour wait and told to just take paracetamol, despite being told he was having an xray.

title: Excellent service
body: Easily completed anima, which was reviewed with a phone call that afternoon, I was asked to attend the surgery within half an hour of the phone call, saw a wonderful GP who diagnosed and prescribed what I needed, excellent friendly staff and professional service.

title: thankyou for your help
body:
just to say thankyou to the lady that helped me on Monday 
she will know who she is
was ringing on behalf of my son for some medication he needed and she sorted it all out for me
I was told last week to just ring back for an appt which I kept missing a slot, but this lady did it all without an appt and kept her promise and rung me back 
a bit of old school service which warms your heart and makes you realise some people still care and will help you 
so thankyou again

title: Reluctant nurses
body: I've had one of the worst nights at this dialysis center tonight it was very difficult to get any of the nurses attention after I was put on I wanted to take my medication with some tea and the nurse who I asked told me to wait while they disconnect their patient but 45 mins later I was still waiting there are no buzzers to call the nurses for things like asking for something to take pills with instead I got a very hot cup of tea and the nurse just left as quickly as the tea came to me then what's worse is I took my blood pressure tablets with this very hot cup of tea very late and not properly as some of the pills got washed back into the cup when I tried to take my pills and I burnt my throat trying to wash the pills down with more hot tea because the nurse only asked if I wanted sugar and I wanted extra milk when I asked a different nurse to get me some water because I've got some pills stuck in my throat she told me to wait while she finished cleaning the machine and acted like she couldn't understand what I was saying I understand that it's not their job to be fetching tea and biscuits but when I have pills to take at a certain time and I have no way to get the nurses attention it makes it difficult to get a decent blood pressure at the end of the session and that ultimately would impact me when I get home because I'd struggle with high blood pressure when I'm trying to get to sleep. I work full time and I can't afford to take sick days because I could take my pills on time and I couldn't get to sleep when I got home

title: Good experience
body: I have had to use this surgery a few  times in the last couple of months and I can not fault them. Appointments are relatively easy to book online. Administration answered and dealt with my queries promptly. The two female GPS I have spoken to have been professional and caring.

title: Aggressive, put newborn’s health at risk
body: A very poor customer service. I came to check up my newborn baby. Doctor invited us, but didn’t speak to us for about 5 minutes, typing something on computer and leaving us wait. Then she asked me to talk about baby’s symptoms. Whatever I mentioned she would aggressively contront, telling that it’s not a valid symptom. I told that I am trying to explain her symptoms as best as I can. Then she asked me to undress the baby. I agreed and asked to close the window, she said that the window doesn’t close. I undressed the baby, but instead of checking the baby she kept saying she needs my concent to check her up with the window being open. I told her that I give my concent, but she kept repeating the same thing keeping the baby waiting undressed. She then said that the baby is fine and her cough is due to producing extensive amount of saliva (the fact that the baby just had a chest infection and had to take antibiotics didn’t seem to be an important data). On our way out I asked administrator for doctor’s name, but she said they can’t give it to me. At that point the doctor started accusing me for attacking her and pointing to a zero tolerance poster on the wall. The baby was crying. The doctor was raising her voice and threatening she will call police. We had to leave. It was extremely stressful. To be honest, not sure why and what hapenned today. It was totally unexpected and undeserved.

title: Excellent, professional Service
body: My appointment was with the Nurse who was friendly, efficient, kind & very personable. Was an ‘enjoyable’ experience.

title: Excellent practice
body: Having experienced the service from several GP practices, this one is by far the best: the support staff and doctors are professional, empathetic and polite, the appointments usually run on time, and the facilities are clean and pleasant. Would recommend.

title: Good follow up
body: The clinic staff are so responsible that they have sent several text reminders so I can book the screening test easily with the link provided.

title: Incredible Practice
body: Best Healthcare Surgery I have ever been to.  All of the Staff are caring, kind, respectful and above all highly professional.  I cannot thank them enough.  After seeing a GP this week I feel more positive than I have done for a very long time.  With all that you have had to do this last few weeks with the closure of a nearby surgery, you have allbeen amazing.  Thank you!!!

title: Outstanding staff and care
body: After an extremely traumatic operation the team at this practice showed care, compassion, support and advice that helped us all no end. Appointments always same day with nurses and doctors. Doctors were always on call to offer advice for nurses, and nurses incredible at helping us understand home care. The compassion and care that this place shows is incredible. I can't thank them enough.

title: Great service
body: Did an econsult , call back on the same day from my own doctor , very pleasant and problem dealt with . Really good practice

title: Very professional and caring
body: I was quite anxious about my colonoscopy. However, the staff nurses and gastroenterologist were very kind, understanding, and professional toward me throughout the entire procedure. They relayed my fears and were very gentle with me throughout. I could not want better service than I received. Thank you

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great surgery
body: Excellent family doctors.  Reliable and quick to respond to your health needs.  Contacted in day of enquiry and appointment the next day.  Very efficient service.

title: Great receptionist
body: I called this morning and spoke to a very friendly and super helpful receptionist (J). I got through on the phone quickly and a telephone appointment arranged. Hopefully I’ll get everything sorted in one call. Thank you

title: Exceptional consultation
body: One of the GPs who unfortunately I am unable to name is exceptional - caring, knowledgeable and nothing is too much trouble. I can’t praise them enough and it’s pretty refreshing in this day and age.

title: I would Recommend this Hospital to revive your…
body: I was diagnosed with type 2 respiratory failure! The Guys & Girls in here sorted me out. I'm sorry I can't name a team leader in here because I feel she warrants recognition ... But I was dealt with promptly, better than my GP practice, & Dispatched with a 1st Class after care. For someone who has a Phobia about hospitals I spent nearly 2 days in the AMU, my Worry was how was I going to cope went I got Home? I know that due to my Medical Fragility I may need to revisit the Hospital sometime soon, but I do know I have no problem with that, & will happily attend. My only problem with leaving a review is you will not allow me to Name & allocate a Positive response to a particular member of staff! Because I feel she needs a 1st Class Response for Her Dedication to Duty! Apart from that, Thank you for what you do & Your Service!

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant organisation
body: Spamedica is welcoming, reassuring, professional and extremely helful. I was put at ease immediatelly by the caring staff. The medical staff were brilliant. the whole experience was great. many thanks.

title: Brilliant Doctors
body: The receptionists are amazing just like the doctors. I am very pleased with the surgery I would never think of going anywhere else.

author: el2356
title: Rehabilitation for amputee
body:
I was admitted to ward 1b rehabilitation amputee unit at musgrave park hospital.  
All staff brilliant nothing is a bother to any of them the go above and beyond for you.  
Shelia the domestic is lovely ward is spotless clean all meals served with a smile no matter what you ask for she will go out of her way to help.  
All patients get on with eachother and it is lovely to be able to talk to others who are going through the same as you.  
Evening times we sat in the dining room just chatting Shelia the duty ward sister brought everyone tea/coffee and joined in with us.  
I must say I haven't laughed as much since my amputation,all the staff said it was lovely just to hear the laughters coming from the room.  
All staff in the physio/ot department also amazing they are worth their weight in gold, especially Catherine (physio)and Kathy (ot).  
I felt so comfortable in the ward aswell as the rehabilitation unit,my family was also made very welcomed and told everything that was happening.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: great practice
body: The reception of the New Islington Medical Practice is always prompt when assisting me, speaks clearly.  They send me a message with the details of the appointment, always cordial and in a good mood!

title: Caring and considerate personnel
body: From receptionist to doctor, I received excellent support and advice following a fainting fit. Cannot praise enough the prompt and thorough examination and follow up advice after hospital tests. Felt supported and cared for throughout, thanks everyone.

title: Very poor
body: I was discharged from hospital with dry healing skin from where they took skin for a skin graft. When discharged to the care of the district nurses, my skin became infected because wrong dressings have been applied. After several calls and being told someone would call me back I was left with no care for an oozing smelly wound. The treatment and care received is well below the standard of care required or expected as my healing skin has now become infected. Unfortunately, due to my immobility, I am unable to seek care elsewhere. Very disappointed.

title: Excellent GP
body:
Had a telephone consultation with one of the GPs regarding my elderly mother. 
The Doctor was very thorough & very kind. A face to face appointment was made for her for the following day. It was excellent service from the initial phone call to reception to the consultation.

author: Relative14
title: Excellent Out of Hours GP service
body:
My mum who is in her eighties started vomiting at home at 11:00 am last Friday. By 2:00 pm she was still being violently sick every 15 mins and her own GP had no emergency appointments available.  
We had to wait until 6:00pm to call NHS 24. The Out of Hours GP came to house and showed 100% empathy, respect, care and professionalism. She gave my mum a jag for sickness and arranged an ambulance for her. I just wanted to write about her as her bedside manner was honestly perfect. I can’t remember her name but I hope she can read this and if she does…. THANK YOU!

author: Yolande2023
title: Poor physiotherapy treatment
body:
I went to Dorchester County Hospital due to a shoulder injury which resulted in arthritis in my sc joint. The physiotherapist told me to lift my arm which was difficult. They then proceeded to give me a sheet of paper with exercises to do at home. Despite me saying I had already tried these, they said that I should do them anyway. I felt that I hadn't received hands on work with my shoulder problem, which still exists to this day.  
It has started to get progressively worse. I felt that it was a excuse not to do a job which they get paid to do. My daughter had exactly the same treatment from the same hospital - just a sheet of paper with a bunch of exercises to do at home. So basically it feels like we are doing their job for them.  
I am now paying for treatment and have received far higher quality of care. Thank god for private physios. I am thankfully on my way to a pain free existence without paracetamol etc. Why cant NHS give the same treatment?

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lucy41
title: Made me feel that I don't want to ask for help again
body:
It saddens me that it has come to this to provide negative feedback to the NHS who I hold in a very high regard. I have had ongoing surgical and gynocology issues for several years and seem to get nowhere when I am admitted into hospital and neither of these departments seem to want to take ownership of me or my health issues. Often seeming to pass the buck from one department to the other. I am always told that I am medically complicated.  
I was admitted to hospital at the beginning of March with a suspected stroke as I was displaying several signs and symptoms of this. After more tests and scans I was moved to AMU where I spent a couple of days getting further tests. Medics where unsure what was wrong with me and one suggested that I could have possibly had a TIA which could have been caused by the HRT that I was prescribed along with the hormone injection I received 4 weeks previous to this hospital admission. I was informed this was my best possible chance of stopping my heavy bleeding (this has been since August 2022). After speaking to several medical staff I repeatedly kept asking to see a gynaecologist while I was in hospital with these issues. I was told several times that they would come and see me and then that they were far too busy to come and see me. I was understandably very upset and angry about this as I believe that I was the HRT that caused this latest hospital admission.  
I was moved up to Ward 27 the same night that I received a very painful lumbar puncture with it taking at least 5 attempts to get through. I was in agony and really scared and stressed as I was still experiencing heavy bleeding and pain. The staff at ward 27 took very good care of me but yet again I was told by a doctor doing his rounds that they were not happy and they would get gynaecology to come and see me. Finally someone was going to help me or so I thought. Yet again they refused to come and when I spoke to another doctor they said that they had suggested to try 2 drugs together to stop the bleeding and that they would book me an urgent outpatient appointment. I was so frustrated going round in circles all the time that I asked if I could speak to a consultant myself and I was told no and they wouldn't go back and ask again for me. Basically that was it. I can't tell you how broken this made me feel and how much this is having an impact on my mental health and well-being and what it is doing to my husband and little girl.  
I took the drugs and was told that I was being discharged later that day. After about 2 hours I started being violently sick and had to be given an anti sickness injection and couldn't go home.  
The treatment that I have experienced from the gynaecology department has been awful. I feel ignored and that they have placed no value in me and I have lost all faith in there ability to treat me as a patient. I am disappointed and disgusted and honesty they have made me feel that I don't want to ask for help again and I certainly don't want to come back in to hospital.  
I have since had to contact the hospital to ask when my urgent appointment is only to be told my consultant is no longer available and another one is leaving too. The first appointment they have is at the end of April and I was informed in the hospital it would be 2 weeks time.

author: Carameltop87
title: I was listened to and treated as a person
body:
I attended the minor injuries unit at FVRH with a really painful knee. I have had problems with my knee for as long as I remember.  
When I arrived in the dept with my husband we had to wait in a seating area. You could see the nurses and doctors were busy but supportive of each other.  
I was seen by an amazing ANP. I unfortunately have forgotten her name but she was fantastic, she put me at ease and the 3 of us had some banter which again helped with feelings of anxiety.  
I was sent for an x-ray and when I returned was waiting about 15 mins max before being seen again. I had a soft tissue injury (felt like a total goofball going to hospital for that) and she referred me to the fracture clinic as a precaution. The ANP gave me fantastic advice on what to do next and provided me with crutches. All this was done within an hour.  
This is a huge thank you for the amazing care I received. I was listened to and treated as a person. Thank you to everyone from the NHS 24 call handler, x-ray and obviously the fantastic ANP.

author: TDWW21
title: Surgery, staff and overall experience
body:
I recently under went planned surgery and can not thank the staff that I met along my way  
Having never had surgery before I was very nervous about how the procedure was going to go, but I really didn't need to be for I was reassured both before and after the surgery by caring and compassionate staff.Staff kept me updated, nothing was ever to much trouble and more importantly they made me feel like I was the only person they were caring for, my thoughts, feelings and needs were always taken into consideration and for that I can not thank them enough.  
The only blip of my stay was that they didn't have a bed for me to move to following surgery and that I was going to have to stay in recovery for the night, which I didn't mind as regardless of where I was I knew I would be receiving Fantastic care. ( a bed eventually became available in ward 5c which I was moved too)  
Special mentions need to go to:  
Professor Kirk, a true gentleman and a credit to the Trust answered all questions I had and made sure I was happy and understood everything fully.  
Nurse Claire in DPU who admitted me and kept my nerves under control whilst I waited for surgery  
Myrtle in the surgery recovery bay, who is one of the most caring nurses I have came across.  
And all the staff in ward 5C especially Nicole.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: RayFaeTroon
title: Very sympathetic too, listened and told me the plan,
body:
I had been feeling feverish since Friday, and nauseous. 30 hours in bed and not eating or drinking much, when I did go to the toilet, it was painful a little at first up to excruciating this morning.  
It only took a minute for 111 to call, and after the usual few questions, I was sent to Crosshouse ED.  
The Staff Nurse who triaged me was very sympathetic, and then after a no more than 2 hour wait, I was seen by Naomi. I was then sent home with antibiotics for 7 days .  
Naomi was very sympathetic too, listened and told me the plan, luckily I was able to go to the toilet for the sample, thus avoiding the need to stay longer to drink and see if a catheter may be needed.  
My only hope now is that a repetition of the time before my previous retention issues which came about after a few antibiotics didn't work. Only time, and the next 24 to 48 hours will tell.  
I have to say that from start to finish, it was a NHS to be proud of, and as a Volunteer for you proud to be a part of it.

author: Ella1
title: first class care
body:
I was taken in to ward 57 last Wed as an emergency. I just have to shout out about the totally amazing 'team'..there was certainly no 'I' in it.  
From morning to night they all worked endlessly and together - each and every one of them were so so kind, caring and professional. I loved watching them all and was in awe of their abilities, from youngsters, who were probably volunteers, to the surgeons, and so very obviously the 'main body' nursing staff..  
You got it right..You are truly amazing and thank you all so very much.

author: yellowpw54
title: He was so happy and said he had the best day
body:
My little boy needed a cannula so he could have a kidney scan. We had an unsuccessful first attempt, which was traumatic for my son. The paediatric team were lovely and really wanted to make sure that when he came back that he felt less anxious and understood what needed to happen.  
The play team spent some time with him the day before (just playing and talking about what would happen the next day). This helped lots with making him feel comfortable with coming back the next day.  
The lady from the play team stayed with us the next day whilst we were at paeds and he successfully had his scan. He was so happy and said he had the best day.  
All the staff that dealt with my son, whilst at the hospital, were really good with him and made his experience a positive one.  
Thank you 😊

author: KJD17
title: Exceptional care
body:
It is of upmost importance I address the exceptional care and support we have received from a wonderful female named Charlotte based at Nottinghamshire Perinatal Mental Health Team. My daughter suffers with a range of complex mental health disabilities and Charlotte has recently finished some extensive work with my daughter to support her needs.  
During this Charlotte was indeed compassionate, dedicated and always approached with care. The support received has been by far exceptional. Her knowledge in mental health and great understanding of all individual uniqueness, is truly inspiring. She is immensely professional, committed to her work and also understands how hard the real world has been made for not only the disabled, but parents and carers included.  
Charlotte has worked incredibly hard to ensure my daughter and her baby are further supported now and into the future. Our family are truly thankful for all the support Charlotte has given. The service received is rare to find especially in today's society. Please take note that the Nottinghamshire Perinatal Mental Health Team genuinely understand the importance of supporting parents with mental health. For sure, in our experience, people will never be overlooked when under this service.  
Charlotte, all the best for the future and I hope your skills bring you many greater achievements.

author: julikenn
title: Prompt dermatology service
body: Sore skin lesion on right ear scraped and cauterised under local anaesthetic. Very promptly seen and dealt with.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: pavohp85
title: Truly incredible humans.
body:
My Mum had a severe stroke at the end of August 2022, spent 12 days in ICU, 5 weeks in Ward 42 at The Victoria hospital and the last 5 months in The Cameron hospital in the stroke ward. She is still there today slowly making progress.  
The staff have been so incredible, unbelievably dedicated, caring and look after Mum who has many challenges with eating (feeding tube), speaking, motor function and inability to walk. It’s been life changing and Mum continues to fight each day.  
The ongoing care and support of all the staff - nurses and charge nurses are angels, the physiotherapists, the occupational therapists, speech therapists and doctors have been and continue to be an amazing team.  
We remain hopeful and stay positive that Mum will make it home this year. We will forever be grateful for all the staff at the hospitals - truly incredible humans.

author: matarzn55
title: Lengthy waiting list
body:
Following contact with NHS Lanarkshire referral management services this morning, I have been informed my daughter who has been on the Neurodevelopment services waiting list for 89 weeks is likely to be seen in around 3.5 years.  
Would welcome the opportunity to discuss further.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Ashley %%
title: Heroin, cocain and institutions or death
body:
I was introduced to gear in prison serving my first sentence for burglary and once released curiosity got the upper hand, I then spent the next 7 years in an out of prison for the funding of my addiction.  
2011 my daughter was born and so I was helped by inclusion to stay sober for the next 7 years....and the support from them was brilliant... I have used the needle exchange van as they are really kind and helpful.

author: ORB South Admin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Inspire group
body:
Inspire Group for 4 weeks  
Asha and Naml have both been amazing! Great service, wished it was longer

author: Simo78
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Fundamental in my recovery so far
body:
I have had a keyworker who has been phenomenally attentive. I think they may be overstretched as my keyworker has a very large caseload. I was alarmed at first at the involvement of childrens services. Social workers attended and closed the case after a 3-hour assessment. Upon reflection, I understand that this was an essential safeguarding action carried out by Inclusion.  
The groups have been brilliant, and the facilitator who has taken most of the groups I have been to manages the different personalities really well.  
I had a negative Inclusion group experience when someone else was running the group. I felt I needed to leave the room on that occasion as the facilitator, who had stepped in, was arguing with a client and it made me feel uncomfortable. I would like to be able to give back to Inclusion, work permitting. It has been fundamental in my recovery so far.

author: Winchester2451
title: A home visit from an Occupational Therapy Nurse.
body:
Today l had a visit from a wonderful Nurse from Occupational Therapy based at Pitlochry, Louise, to assess how l could benefit from any aids available to help me in my home as l am in constant pain and have very restricted mobility.  
I honestly could not have asked for a kinder and sincerely understanding person to help me.  
She was absolutely wonderful in every way possible and has really brightened up my day.  
l cannot praise her enough for the compassion that she showed me during her visit.  
Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: JennS
title: Appreciated the consideration they gave to treating a toddler
body:
I attended Inverclyde Royal Hospital A&E with my little boy last week. He had a high fever and facial swelling that was progressing, as well as chicken pox, he was very unwell and it was an extremely worrying time.  
The staff went above and beyond to get my son the care and treatment he needed. I really appreciated the nurses and doctors keeping myself and my husband informed of his plan of care so we were never left in the dark, I also appreciated the consideration they gave to treating a toddler and making him feel at ease, especially when dealing with things like cannulation and taking bloods etc.  
He was blue lighted to the Queen Elizabeth and again the care he received by the paramedic team on route to QE was second to none.  
I just wanted to say a huge thank you to everyone involved in looking after my son, the care and compassion we were given will not be forgotten!

author: ariesgd49
title: Alcohol Detoxification experience
body:
So in March 2023 I was referred for alcohol detox by CGL Brighton following a self-referral approximately 14 months prior. I was originally due to do a home detox in August 2022 but at the last minute this was switched to an inpatient detox due to concerns about the health of my liver following an ultrasound that showed some issues that needed to be closely monitored. At the time I was quite disappointment by this decision as I wanted to proceed with the detox as soon as possible but unfortunately had to wait a further 6 months for an admission date.  
Since being here I have found all of the staff to be very kind and informative and I also found the other inpatients to be very welcoming and friendly. Medication was administered at regular intervals and all of my questions were answered by the staff to the best of their abilities. The food provided was excellent if I was to give any criticism of that it was that choice was limited to one or possibly 2 options however the quality was not in doubt.  
I think at times there could have been slightly better communication between CGL and Dame Carol for example CGL arranged for my discharge transport to be provided on a date when no discharge was available.  
Overall I would say the experience was excellent and my only main source of concern was that the mattress' provided did not suit a painful back condition that would interrupt my sleep more than I felt was necessary, however I accept this may be due to my specific medical needs and I do not know if other inpatients suffered with the same issue.  
Other than some minor technical issues that were quickly resolved I would say my overall experience was excellent and I would very much like to thank all of the staff for their kind and considerate manner and would recommend the facility to anyone who in genuinely seeking help to better themselves regardless of the specific nature of their addiction or addictions.

author: Mummy69
title: Compassionate and professional
body: My teenage daughter has been having physiotherapy for a few years now. The service she has received has been amazing, the team that have treated her have been patient, compassionate and professional and I can’t praise them highly enough for all of their hard work and dedication to their profession.

author: lacertaqk79
title: Caring for my eyes.
body:
I attended the Shankill well-being centre in Belfast today. I want to give a shout out for first of all to Kyle at reception who reorganized my appointment without any fuss and in a friendly manner. Next once again I was looked after at the field screening by the ever professional Gregory who always puts you at your ease.  
Finally many thanks to the ophthalmologist Dr Logan who checked my eyes thoroughly and I'm glad to say all was okay.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Absolute shambles
body:
The care afforded by this practice is appalling.
My wife and I have power of attorney for our parents who are frail and need help… we have tried to make an appointment for them but find the reception staff rude and disinterested. They start from a position of “no”. 
They promised an urgent phone call from a gp.. no call was received in the next 48 hours… and so the whole useless process started again.
Finally my mother in law was seen. .. unfortunately the consultation was most ineffectual: we witnessed a gp who didn’t take any control of the situation and made no decisions! This is a poor excuse for care!

title: Awful practice told me to never call 111
body: Waited for just over 4 hours just to get seen for less than a minute. The doctor didn't even touch me- he just took one glance at my swollen blue, purple and black abscesses before sending me home. I told him 111 sent me to have them looked at as they were rapidly worsening and causing me a great amount of pain. He then said 'never call 111. They'll just send you to us even if you don't need it'.  Parts of my skin have literally peeled off to reveal fat deposits underneath. The wounds are constantly weeping and bleeding. I'm sick of the NHS doing this. Your doctors don't deserve better pay if you can't even organize yourselves. Anyone can look at my condition and know that I need serious help- but a doctor can't be asked to even run a single test on the infections that are clearly there. There's no point in a healthcare system that doesn't do its job.

author: Amymg68
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Being treated by the Frailty Wards
body:
Broken hip and went to hospital. They did other test results on me, however they discharged me before the results came back.  
I was handed to the virtual ward team who got my results and very quickly prescribed me antibiotics. The virtual ward was like having a life line, they were caring and supportive. They carried on the calls for me for as long as I requested, they improved my confidence in managing my condition at home.

readBy.name: Hampshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust / Virtual Wards

author: plusnp45
title: My cataract
body: The hospital were well mannered and very supportive

title: Long-standing ineptitude to the patients cost
body: Week after week there is always an excuse for poor service - Staff shortages, new systems, etc but this has been ongoing for over a year and for the past 4 months I’m having to chase repeat prescriptions that gave seemingly not been received - the amount of wasted time it takes to rectify this by several calls to the pharmacist and the practice to get this resolved is ludicrous and uneccessarily stressful - how much longer can they continue to operate in such a way which is extremely detrimental to the health of their patients like myself - 2/10

title: Still waiting for results appointment
body:
After two plus weeks I'm still waiting for a rescheduled appointment to hear my prostate biopsy results. 

The general hospital appointments team can't do anything as they say they are waiting on Urology. The phone to Urology is never answered. 

If Leicester values client feedback you won't ask me to contact your Patient Liaison Team to make a complaint, but instead you'll ask Urology to respond to me with an appointment time.

You have my details in the contact I filled out to leave this comment, so over to you...

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

author: foxtrotgd73
title: Pregnancy Termination
body:
After a horrific miscarriage at home last year I felt completely let down by health care professionals by lack of privacy and compassion. This year we were lucky enough to fall pregnant again. But I am on a high amount of medications and the doctors offered termination in case of foetal malformation or to take our chances. Paralysis from late term pregnancy wasn’t ruled out either and was a major concern for me and my husband.  
After a lengthy discussion we decided to terminate this pregnancy for my mental and physical well-being. It was heart breaking. Yet the care I received was second to none. My only regret is not coming to this hospital at our time of need during my miscarriage. Unfortunately it’s left us with the heart breaking decision to not try again.

author: decemberek69
title: Minor injuries unit and X-ray
body:
My son had a foot injury and was not improving with rest, we were directed to Arbroath MIU by NHS 24. He was seen promptly and with great care by a compassionate and professional team.  
Thank you so much for looking after him

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

author: foxtrotbp56
title: Kind staff
body: Kind staff on hand carrying out the cervical biopsy. I was seen promptly and on time of appointment. I was provided with easy to understand terminology about the procedure.

author: JennS
title: Thank you to all the staff who were involved in my sons care
body:
My little boy was admitted to ward 2C after an A&E visit following a suspected bacterial infection. The staff in the ward were very attentive and kind during his stay , the nursing students in particular were extremely helpful and informative.  
This was the first time my son had been in hospital , the Ear Nose & Throat (ENT) team , nurses , consultants and students made us feel at ease and kept us informed of my sons plan of care (I really appreciated this) they were great with my son and always tried get him involved in his own care (again something I really appreciated and noticed was clearly a priority for the staff here, which made such a difference)  
Thank you to all the staff who were involved in my sons care , your kindness, care and compassion will not be forgotten!

title: Consistently awful
body: Helpful doctors but appalling reception. Very long waits (hours) on phone and in person for appointments. Once waited 4 months for a Repetitive Strain Injury consultation (self employed, couldn't work) because reception forgot to send the form off. Latest incompetence- today I waited 20 minutes at the surgery for a simple repeat prescription. Just been to the pharmacy to pick it up and discovered the prescription is invalid. I am now without my medication and looking forward to a long wait tomorrow and another 2 journeys to rectify their mistake. Just not good enough.

title: Incredibly disorganised
body: This practice is incredibly disorganised. They have lost referrals in the system, repeatedly failed to upload documents and test reports to my medical file, there is no consistency in follow-up after consultations, the  medical advice between doctors is conflicting. The list goes on. The worst is you can tell them about all this and there seems to be little concern about improving anything.

title: Very Rude
body: I know that surgery receptionists can be busy but when a patient is asking a question and being pleasant to them, staff should be just as pleasant in return.  The staff member cutting in and cutting you off whilst speaking with them is extremely rude and makes one feel as if you are not worthy enough for them to deign their time on you.  Courtesy costs nothing.

title: such a battle to get an appointment
body:
Such a battle to get an appointment.

1) when calling to book an appointment there are never any available even if you say you can wait 3-4 weeks as it isn't urgent.
> the receptionist then advised to call back at 8:45am the next day to ask for an emergency appointment, even though it is not an emergency, but this is the only way to get an appointment

2) calling at 8:45am to get an emergency appointment. 
* Calling at 8:44am: "sorry the surgery isn't open yet, please call back during opening hours".
* Calling at 8:45am on the dot: "you're now 48 on the queue".
After being 33 minutes on hold and being from 48 to 9 on the queue the call hangs up.
* I called back straight away, and the Receptionist answered after being on hold this time for "only" 15 minutes. The Receptionist says, "sorry no emergency available as they've all been given, call back tomorrow morning". But I've been calling the practice for 3 days at 8:45am and every day is the same.

When complaining about it the Receptionist says got to the A&E department > this is extremely unethical as my medical issues are not urgent, no wonder the A&E is always full as most surgery do not give any appointments.

Other advice by the Receptionist calls 111. I do call 111 but their advice is call your doctor.

This was the same scenario before the Pandemic but has gone so much worst since.
The practice needs an auditor to come & review.

Additionally, doctors are always either on annual leave or they’re sick.

Furthermore, the whole practice isn't tidy, so many posters displayed they don't make sense anymore, they just look like advertisements instead of medical poster. 

There is a tablet to book your arrival (at least pre-Pandemic) and 9 times out of 10 it was not working, so you had to wait so long at the reception.

Receptionists are not very friendly either (some are luckily).

However, if miraculously, you do see a doctor, there are mostly very polite and nice - well that was pre-Pandemic as since I never manage to see any. The face-to-face consultation barely last 5 minutes, this includes research on google, taking the tension and writing prescription. So can't call that a consultation.
The phone consultation that I finally had after calling for 3 days in a row was equally from a very nice and polite GP but that lasting barely 5 minutes, I didn't have time to list all my symptoms, so she let me talk and the whole call lasted 12 minutes, including the explanation of the medicine she was giving me as these were new to me.

Do not register there. I'm trying to find a new surgery but, in my area, they aren't taking new patients.

title: Not recommended at all !
body:
We've been calling our GP every now and then either for some of my wife's medical issues or for our kids.
Several problems in communication can almost never find an appointment when you need one, and if by a slight chance you do, if you miss the GP's call (as they examine you by phone, which I still don't understand) you have to start the process all over again and book another one.
Very disappointed overall, already thinking of finding another GP.
I have concerns about my health sometimes and due to what I'm having to go through, I don't even want to call them.

title: Online prescription not working
body: I tried to order some prescriptions this morning. It’s now 8.15  and it’s saying the surgery is closed which it’s not because I’ve just spoken to someone about an appointment.

title: What happend to Belmont hill surgery?
body:
I have been registered with Belmont hill surgery for ten years,it was very good,but I don't know what happend,the reception area,is cold,and disinterested,empty, sad.,no enthusiasum
I was told I had an appt,I never had a reminder,and never made an appt,to my knowl dge,I have to constantly request,my prescription,it never goes thru to Belmont pharmacy,and a call from the Dr,is random,and I can never get back,to him,to follow up,as an appt takes for ever.there is no enthusiasm,and the service is poor,it was great before.now it's a disappointing.

author: oscarmr93
title: Grateful to everyone involved in my treatment and care
body:
I had a stroke around one evening in January 2023. The ambulance strike was due to start at midnight.  
My neighbour called 111 who ordered an ambulance. Ambulance arrived within 15 minutes. Taken to QMC resuscitation unit. Within 20 minutes I had a CT scan and was offered thrombolysis treatment which I accepted.  
Was up in bed in a ward soon after midnight. Had MRI scan that afternoon and no brain bleed so was allowed home. Brilliant.  
As I live alone it was very reassuring to receive a visit from Alice of the stroke support team. She was excellent. Over a series of visits she helped me to understand my symptoms…. brain fog, fatigue, poor balance, weakened right leg. The exercises I was given proved beneficial though I had to stop using the balance mat. It upset my arthritic knee.  
I am so grateful to everyone involved in my treatment and care.That it was so prompt may, I feel, have lessened the potential impact of the stroke.  
Thank you everybody.

title: Awful reception staff
body:
I booked a phone call consultation which I asked for after 4pm. No One Called!!  

So I called the following day.. they called me back while I was finished off an important work call, I answered and said can you hold for 1 minute while I finished the call (was just saying goodbyes) all I could hear from the reception was “for god sake hurry up” “oh hurry up” huffing and puffing! I checked I had been 1 minute 20 seconds. This receptionist was so so rude!! I then tried to explain my situation from the day before that no one called she didn’t apologise for it, shrugged it off and just said well what’s your name then so I can book you in!! 
The receptionist at this place make the company the worst. Find better staff!!!

title: Amazing amazing
body: We recentpy moved to Sheffield and registered with Upperthorpe. .  The service and care i have recieved from reception,nurses, doctor and physio has been nothing short of thorough. I have felt listened to for the1st time ever at a doctors.

title: Excellent care
body: Thank you to a wonderful nurse whose professional approach combined with kindness and sensitivity made a procedure the best in years. Also thank you to the receptionist who passed on the extra information I gave her when I made the appointment. I really appreciated that team work.

title: Good service
body: Effective, prompt, informative service. Good follow up. On time. Helpful service following appointment with good provision on site.

title: Great
body: Always friendly I don’t know how they could be better. Professional and quick without rushing. Always leave me feeling looked after.

title: Outstanding service and efficiency
body: my first eye was done in November my second in February.From start to finish care and consideration with the highest level of efficency and service.I had an infection in my first eye which was dealt with immediately with additional checks and medication. The second eye has been so smooth.

title: Fantastic support
body: I was admitted to the ward last week. My stay was wonderful even though i was in pain. The nurses were so kind and understanding. Honestly big thumbs up to all the staff though. You work so hard and still manage to put a smile on patients faces. Thank you so much.

title: Great practice
body: Lovely practice nurse who was very friendly and informative. Submitted a request for an appointment online and I was called before the end of the day. Very prompt!

title: Rude reception staff,
body:
They tell you call back at 8ap for emergency appointments, they don't have waiting system on phone calls, straight away show line is busy, I have called about over 79 time to get through by the time I have managed to talk they say yo need to keep try calling.
Rude lady was on phone not try understand me, I said I need to see the doctor I have tried to call from 8am but u were so busy, she was getting so rude, she was like u need try again tomorrow and there is no appointments until next 2 week

title: Brilliant GP Surgery!
body: This time I called was due to my child, the receptionist let me explain the issue & got me a call back. The Dr was lovely, explained the issue/ options, gave me reasurrance and what to look out for and then reminded me at the end, if I was concerned at any time just call back & explain to reception & they would get a face to face booked in.

title: So Helpful
body: I would like to thank everyone for being so kind with the recent passing of my husband. The GP I saw was very understanding and helpful. The reception staff were extremely helpful as well, and everyone has been so nice at losing the love of my life. Thank you Jenner House. Because of your help I am feeling so much better.

title: Excellent Doctor
body: Really felt that I was listened to and the Doctor fully understood what was wrong with me. The Doctor took the time to deal with my issue and explain to me what was wrong and how they were going to help me.

title: Practice in decline
body:
Last time, when I ordered my repeat prescription online the GP did not approve it and send me a message asking me to see a GP. I stayed for 3 weeks without medication till I got an appointment with the GP.

Now I was supposed to have a blood test on 28/02/2023, to be started on a new medication. On 27/02/2023 I was contacted to be told my appointment has been cancelled. I was able to make another one in two weeks time which is today, 15/03/2023, to my surprise wgen I woke up I found an sms, sent at 8:45, saying it is cancelled.

Now I am calking the reception. It's been 44 mins and I am in queue position 3.

This is the new system they introduced to pass their problems to the patient. It is frustrating..

title: Pharmacist has been very helpful
body: Having recently had some medication changed the pharmacist has been very helpful with telephone conversations checking for changes in my health

author: danceyf45
title: My daughter has learned so much!
body:
My daughter has just completed the Fit4fun course and has learnt so much! The sessions have always been informative, well paced, and helped her understand the importance of reading labels and making healthier food choices.  
She was able to set her own goals, pick her own exercises and was given appropriate activities to complete between sessions, but with no pressure. The information pack we received was outstanding, it was very helpful to have our own visual of what was being spoken about. The included recipe book has been well used!I would recommend this course to any one who feels their child would benefit from non judgemental guidance and support around food and healthy eating.

title: Appauling treatment
body: I have asthma, and made an appointment to have an asthma check up with the nurse, as I was finding the condition was getting worse.  I duly went along at the appointed time, and checked in and then sat down to wait.  After 30 minutes, and being the only person in the waiting area, I asked the receptionist how much longer it would be as I had taken time away from work.  The receptionist advised he would send a note to the nurse, and within seconds of that I heard someone in a very loud voice saying "well that's just great, just great.  I need to be out of here by one and so don't have time for this!"  Now I can't be sure this was about me, but it was very coincidental.  I waited a further 10 minutes and then went back.  The receptionist looked very embarrassed and asked if I would like to make another appointment, which I declined.  I ended up going to a private GP who found my peak flow was deplorable, and I am now on a treatment plan.  I left Heathfielde surgery feeling very upset, and like I was an invisible nuisance.  What happened to the days when patients were treated like human beings, not numbers and inconveniences?

title: Not fit for purpose
body: Unable to get regular meds. Waits a week then nothing. Told I have to wait for a prescriber. A week later he rings can barely understand. Given an alternative but I don't want an alternative as I have sourced the exact one and reserved elsewhere but guess what I have to wait another week for a prescriber. Doesn't seem to matter I'm without my blood pressure meds as they seem totally unsympathetic or caring. An absolute joke of a practice. Great at sending inappropriate text messages but rubbish at actually doing right by their patients. So badly done too and over worked these poor GP's.

title: Nurse
body:
The service provided by the nurse, is at a high professional level. Very caring.

Some of the reception staff are very helpfully whlist others can't even be bothered to get off their chair.

title: Excellent care
body: Friendly , efficient, thorough care. Providing a good service despite underfunding. I went straight in without waiting.

title: Not Great
body:
The reception staff are lovely and accommodating however they can’t create appointments that aren’t available. 
It’s constantly ring back at 8am or no prebookables. The rare times I have used the surgery I have waited more than 50 minutes for my actual appointment. Today my 10.10am for my poorly son, I was seen at 11.05am. The doctors are locums so no familiar face.

title: Pruh A&E reception refuse to pick up the phone
body:
Good Luck if your elderly parent gets admitted and you live far away.
The receptionists at A&E will not pick up the phone when you're trying to find out your relatives whereabouts.
As always with the Pruh there's no other provision to assist.
My experience with this place ,the worst, without fail everytime.
At least I can give them 5 stars for being consistently awful.
I'm talking about 5 separate occasions over 10 hours for 30 minutes holding on each time.
I've not seen anything about a Jumbo Jet crashing in Bromley if we are very busy the normal excuse is rolled out.

author: allypally49
title: Inconsistency about mask wearing
body:
I find it confusing that my local health centre now encourages us to get back to normal by having no requirement to wear a mask, yet another local health centre has notices up saying its a requirement, and not strongly recommended as per the Scottish Government's advice.  
The latest Cochrane report has concluded that wearing any kind of face covering probably makes little or no difference in reducing the spread of respiratory illness.

title: Cancelled
body:
After breathing problems my GP sent me for XRay and then an appointment at Barnet.   The appointment was fineness for late summer but was cancelled 3 weeks later.  No new appointment no reason just cancelled.   
This shows a lack of care towards the client and poor back room management to the level of incompetents.  
The poor communication between support services and the front line is a NHS characteristic

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust
